text: Asiadapis is a genus of adapiform primate that lived in India's Cambay Shale Formation during the early Eocene (Ypresian). It has two known species, Asiadapis cambayensisK. D. Rose, R. S. Rana, A. Sahni and T. Smith. 2007. A new adapoid primate from the early Eocene of India. Contributions from the Museum of Paleontology, University of Michigan 31(14):379-385 and Asiadapis tapiensis. ==References== Category:Prehistoric strepsirrhines Category:Eocene primates Category:Eocene mammals of Asia Category:Prehistoric primate genera Category:Fossil taxa described in 2007
title: Asiadapis
